I ordered one of the Russian samplers and the bartender gave me an accidentally generous pour of ZYR vodka.  Then he actually picked up my shooter and poured it back into the ZYR bottle and said "oops".  WTF?  Uhm, no. If you overpour by an ounce or two you just don't do that.  That vodka flight was $47 or so plus tax and tip... do you really have to pour back a couple ounces?

The food was really good but the service was slow. 

First, I'd like to know why it took us so long to try this place. As Las Vegas locals, we rarely think about eating on the strip. We had a staycation at the Delano and decided to do an all day event on the hotel. I did not want to leave the hotel to go anywhere or drive. 

It was getting later in the evening and I was getting upset because I was starving. I picked this spot based on review, I also called and they allowed my kids to dine too, and because Groupon gave me a generous credit. 

The decor of the place was very Victorian, so to me it looked a little dusty but it's ok because anything old should look dusty. (The place was not dusty by the way.) the lights were nice and dim and it was so red inside, so red it was so ridiculous like me, I LOVED IT! The chandelier was huge and it looked like it can tell a lot of stories. 

The kids had the Kobe sliders with fries. No truffle oil or anything fancy for them. They ate their food so I say it was good. My husband had the 20oz ribeye with mushroom risotto. He was in love! The ribeye was delicious, flavorful, every bite felt like it was melting in your mouth. There was also this broiled/steamed tomato on top of the ribeye that complimented the ribeye so well. I was expecting basic tomato flavor but I got a kick of sweet, tangy, salt and pepper.  I settled for the short rib stroganoff and I seriously said, "OMG," with every bite. I get overwhelmed with the truffle flavor but this was PERFECT. 

We would come back here again, maybe without kids. 

Oh, the Sin of Blood is good too. I think that's the name of the cocktail.

Was meeting a friend for drinks and we thought we would check out Red Square.  First off, the entire Bar is an Ice Block which is rather unique.  I had the bartender suggest a vodka for me (which I don't recall the name) which was very good but at $20, it should be.  The bar area is somewhat small and but, we enjoyed our evening and drinks.

Check them out sometime!!
New Menu. Great Food. Fantastic Service. No complaints. No issues. Will come back. They made our wedding Anniversary and my birthday feel special.

Definitely a rocky dinner. 90% of our food was perfect, but what they failed to fix is the loss of a star. My boyfriend was the only one who ordered Chicken Kiev at my table and unfortunately it was way to dry and made it hard for him to enjoy. He asked our server if they could remake it and she made it happen. The problem was they brought him a new one and it was dry too! They made up for it by giving him a complimentary shrimp cocktail and dessert but he really wanted to eat an actual meal so it only made up for it so much. 

The caviar they have is amazing here, and I can't imagine not ordering it. (Go big or go home with the caviar folks)

Yucky food! We order the salmon and filet mignon. Both dishes were very salty . We were starving so we ate it but we did mention to the waiter that we didn't like our salty food . We paid $90 for food that we didn't like. What a disappointment . We will never return. The waiter provided great service too bad the food sucked
Amazing food. Had the flat iron steak, it came with 2 different sauces. All I can say is "give me another steak". It's worth another try. The orange fuz vodka, Yumm, Yumm...

This place is a typical high end, themed, vegas bar.  I enjoyed the theme as it was done rather well in my opinion.  The booths on the left are very nice and the atmosphere is very conducive to a small group of friends chatting.  

The cocktail prices are fitting of the establishment. AKA overpriced, but you have to know that going in.  I mistakenly ordered the hot pepper martini and imagine it to be very similar to drinking battery acid without the lingering physical damages to your face.  Keep in mind, I LOVE spicy/hot food. I can do shots of Tapatio and Jalapenos for days on end.  This martini was horrid.  The taste etc was as if they had just gotten Albertsons charcoal filtered jug vodka and mixed in paint thinner.  Everyone elses drink was ok but nothing to write home about.

It's late, you're in Vegas, you want to go somewhere chill and have a drink away from the slot machines, away from the cheesy casino bar bands, away from the crazy club music... ENTER RED SQUARE! 

We hit up Red Square and were lucky enough to be greeted by four empty seats right up at the bar! We ordered our drinks, set them on the ice to keep them chilly and got to enjoy eachother's company and our drinks! They've got the amputated head of Lenin in the Vodka freezer with the fake bird poop on his head and all! The dinning room is decorated in deep, lush, but soothing red velvety tones and I couldn't help but notice the chandeliers.

I like Vodka, I like Russian History sooooo I was pretty sure I was going to like this place.... now I just need to try the food here!

Red Square is absolutely amazing and deserves 5 very bright stars. 

Red Square is a good restaurant for you if you sexy things. The decor is sexy, the bar is sexy, the people are sexy... even the food is kind of an aphrodisiac. Upon entrance, you'll notice how your mood changes :) Plus, if you're a vodka fiend like me, this will be your heaven.

It gets packed so make sure you have a reservation weeks in advance. If you were to try one restaurant in Mandalay Bay, let this be it.

As a bar I found Red Square to be a bit of a disappointment.
They rock hard on the decor and I give them props for that.  The location is fair and the service was ok but not memorable.  The have Guiness from in bottles, for $8.  It is Vegas, but still.
For their mixed drinks they have some fairly solid ones but nothing that knocked me off my feet.
You really can find better places to go in Vegas.  It is fine to stop by after dinner but I would recommend one drink and then head off somewhere else.
The straight-Russian themed bar/restaurant.
What's good-mixed drinks, having money
The slap-not a great crowd and not great to hang around.

Zdrahstvooy!  On the mall of the Mandalay Bay is a one-of-a-kind dining experience called Red Square.  As the commercial says, "opulence, I has it!"  This place was incredible.  As you walk up to Red Square you are greeted by the beheaded statue of Vladimir Lenin.  The mood is set and this is not the Cold War's Russia...but a venture forward into the modern excess that has swept the country for those who weren't devastated by the economic transition to capitalism.

As I was in Vegas with a group of guys, we started the evening off the only way we could, but drinking with Vladimir himself.  For a costly $300, we bought a bottle of Kettle One and the right to don fur coats in the decked out sub-zero bar (the Vodka Vault)  where Lenin's frozen head encased in glass provides the bar for your sub-zero Vodka.  It's worth saying, this pricey endeavor wasn't bad when you figure 8 of us had about 3 - 4 shots each, and there was vodka left.  You're paying at least that much if you're at the bar, and no fur coats, over-sized throne to sit at, and certainly, no Lenin's head!  The choice was clear for us as to the variety of Vodka, but if you wanted another, the room is stocked!  Some restaurants have lengthy wine lists; this is Russia, and though wine is on the menu, Vodka is the focus!

For my meal, I indulged in the tasting menu.  Whenever i go to a new restaurant, I like to get the lay of the land.  In this case, it was perfect as the portions were ample, but not overfilling, and the selection was wonderful!  The meal began with Amuse Bouche, literally meaning a small bite before the meal, paired with champagne.  The decadent hors d'¬úuvre was lovely toasted bruchetta with a  light seared tuna, a delicious savory drizzle topped with delicate caviar.  I had arrived. 

The second round was my choice of three appetizers, of which I chose the peppered calamari.  As an Italian boy who grew up with calamari, I wasn't sure how the Ruskies would do, and wasn't let down.  When they say peppered, they aren't kidding and it was wonderful.  Perfectly breaded, deliciously tender and wonderfully spicy, this was a great way to make sure my taste buds were still working after my vodka starter!

My third course was a delicious house salad.  It was nothing special, but it wasn't a garden salad either.  Delicious arugula kept with the peppered theme of the appetizer and though, I'm quite certain it wasn't a Russian themed portion of the meal, it was appreciated.  The salad was followed by a pallet cleansing Intermezzo, a term I knew from music as an 'in-between' that brings two parts together, but have never so elegantly had tied into a meal.  This delicious treat which was a small cordial flute filled with a dollup of vanilla ice cream in a lovely champagne was a perfect way to ready myself for the main course, my steak. 

When I stay steak, I don't want to confuse you...as this wasn't dad's steak either.  Instead, it was the deliciously sinful Roquefort Crusted Filet Mignon.  To say this was incredible was an understatement.  When going for the gusto on a large meal, fillet is always my first choice.  it's delicious, it's often something the chef's can cook to order well, and it's not over-sized.  This fit the bill perfectly.  Cooked to a wonderfully warm medium rare, the fillet encrusted with a delicious cheese and atop of amazingly garlicy pureed potatoes...it was fantastic.  It's worth noting that there are two flavors I love above all others...the creamy tangyness of cheeses and the wonderful comfort of garlic, and this had both!  Not to mention, the steak was cooked perfectly.  It was a delicious salty crust on the outside that gave way to velvety red of a perfectly medium rare steak, all topped with a red wine sauce, and it was wonderful!

At this point, you could've suck a fork in me, as I was done, but they weren't!  The final course of this journey in opulence was the dessert, a caramel-vanilla bean creme brulee that was phenomenal!  I love creme brulee and often find it either not crispy enough on top or too watery on the bottom, this was perfect in both regards.  

In the end, this gets my five stars because the food was amazing (as was the food of the other 7 guys who were there), the service was excellent, the ambiance transported you a continent away to world's largest country, and the experience from top to bottom was one to be savored.  This was a great idea, and I owe my friend Jay for making this happen, as it was well worth the wait and cost.  And, while I'm on that, my tasting menu, incredibly reasonable at $65...yeah, that's it.  Get there people, get ready for a great meal, and enjoy!

Among some of the corny flashing lights, endless buffets, and countless scantily clad cocktail servers, there are actually some amazing bars and restaurants popping up all over Las Vegas.  Red Square is one of them.  

Yes, admittedly, the bar made of ice (normal bar but with a patch of ice running down the middle to set your drink on or play with if you are a strange person) was the deciding factor on entering this bar.  Just walking in and seeing the amazing architecture, chandeliers, and unique 3-story painting on the wall was worth the time.  I saw the place almost as a Haunted Mansion...but one you can sip delicious beverages at!

I don't drink martinis and hardly drink while we are at it.....but these cocktails that the highly socially gifted bartender, Kerry, made for us were out of control.  Key Lime Pie Martini rimmed with graham crackers and their House Vodka infused with Mango Martini both rocked the taste buds and soothed the mood.  

Although I didn't get to dine at this fine establishment, I will definitely be back again at least for another cocktail. This place will be at Mandalay Bay Hotel and Casino for a long time!
